intro: Thalictrum austrotibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau and adjacent areas in China. The plant features slender, branched stems and delicate, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in upright, branched inflorescences, typically displaying yellow or greenish-white petals. Thalictrum austrotibeticum thrives in moist, cool environments and is often found in meadows and alpine habitats.
